intro: Tribulus bimucronatus var. inermis, commonly known as the smooth tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. This species is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and resilience to harsh conditions.
